course.subject: ENGG
course.name: Design for Global Health
course.description: A group / individual special project supervised by one or a group of faculty members. Students are required to conduct a project on a specified topic related to Global Health. Team will set objectives at the beginning of the term. There will be several task-based assessments throughout the term to check their progress. At the end of term students need to show case their output in a form of roadshow and submit the final report to the teaching team. Students may repeat the course for credits for at most three times. Instructor's approval is required for enrollment in the course.

reviews.author: Jeongahn
reviews.comment_content: During the semester, you work on a global health related project with your teammates. Weekly sessions are composed of lectures from different guest lecturers, group meetings and presentations. What's cool about this course is that you get to visit the site during summer to actually implement the project. For my case, I was able to visit Cambodia to implement my hygiene education project.
reviews.comment_teaching: The course is not really about learning certain concepts and studying with books. It's more interactive and the group project is the major focus of this course.
reviews.comment_grading: My teammates and I worked hard and actively reflected the comments from professors and staffs. So I earned a good grade. However, I also heard from my friends that the grade seemed to be subjective and didn't reflect the efforts they put into their projects.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is quite heavy. You need to consistently put effort to this project throughout the whole semester. I had many more group meetings in addition to the regular weekly meetings during course time. The course consists of several long presentations to report on the plan and progress of the project, final roadshow and a final report.
